Container.Name: TrafegoDNS
Container.Overview: TrafegoDNS automatically manages DNS records based on container configuration. It supports both Traefik integration and direct Docker container label mode, making it compatible with any web server or reverse proxy solution. Key Features: - Supports multiple DNS providers (Cloudflare, DigitalOcean, Route53) - Two operation modes: Traefik API integration or direct Docker labels - Optional cleanup of orphaned DNS records - Real-time monitoring of Docker container events - Please refer to the readme before deploying this container: https://github.com/elmerfds/TrafegoDNS

Config.Name: Operation Mode
Config.Description: Choose how to detect hostnames: Traefik API or direct container labels

Config.Name: DNS Provider
Config.Description: Select DNS provider to use

Config.Name: Cloudflare Token
Config.Description: Cloudflare API token (requires DNS edit permissions) - Required when using Cloudflare provider

Config.Name: Cloudflare Zone
Config.Description: Your domain name managed in Cloudflare (e.g., example.com) - Required when using Cloudflare provider

Config.Name: DigitalOcean Token
Config.Description: DigitalOcean API token (requires write access) - Required when using DigitalOcean provider

Config.Name: DigitalOcean Domain
Config.Description: Your domain name managed in DigitalOcean (e.g., example.com) - Required when using DigitalOcean provider

Config.Name: Route53 Access Key
Config.Description: AWS IAM access key with Route53 permissions - Required when using Route53 provider

Config.Name: Route53 Secret Key
Config.Description: AWS IAM secret key - Required when using Route53 provider

Config.Name: Route53 Zone
Config.Description: Your domain name managed in Route53 (e.g., example.com) - Required when using Route53 provider

Config.Name: Traefik API URL
Config.Description: URL to Traefik API (including protocol and port) - Only used when Operation Mode is 'traefik'

Config.Name: Cleanup Orphaned
Config.Description: Whether to automatically remove orphaned DNS records

Config.Name: Config Path
Config.Description: Configuration storage path

Config.Name: Docker Socket
Config.Description: Docker socket for container monitoring

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: User ID to run as

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: Group ID to run as

Config.Name: Log Level
Config.Description: Logging level

Config.Name: Preserved Hostnames
Config.Description: Comma-separated list of hostnames to preserve from cleanup (supports wildcards)

Config.Name: Managed Hostnames
Config.Description: Comma-separated list of hostnames to create and maintain (format: hostname:type:content:ttl:proxied)

Config.Name: Traefik API Username
Config.Description: Optional basic auth username for Traefik API - Only used when Operation Mode is 'traefik'

Config.Name: Traefik API Password
Config.Description: Optional basic auth password for Traefik API - Only used when Operation Mode is 'traefik'

Config.Name: Route53 Zone ID
Config.Description: Alternative to ROUTE53_ZONE: Your Route53 hosted zone ID - Only used when DNS Provider is 'route53'

Config.Name: Route53 Region
Config.Description: AWS region for Route53 API calls - Only used when DNS Provider is 'route53'
